message.content:
I'll calculate the requested financial ratios step by step based on the provided financial statements.

## 1. Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets ÷ Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $6,951,011.84 ÷ $737,762.05
Current Ratio = 9.42

## 2. Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit ÷ Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($1,075,241.17 ÷ $5,755,241.17) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = 18.68%

## 3. Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities ÷ Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $737,762.05 ÷ $12,385,382.42
Debt to Asset Ratio = 0.06

## 4. Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit ÷ Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = (-$1,352,379.63 ÷ $5,755,241.17) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = -23.50%

## 5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) ÷ Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (-$206,636.07 + $2,406.99) ÷ $737,762.05
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = -$204,229.08 ÷ $737,762.05
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = -0.28

## 6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -$7,724,112.71 - $480,116.37
FCF = -$8,204,229.08

## 7. Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit ÷ Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = (-$1,352,379.63 ÷ $12,385,382.42) × 100%
ROA = -10.92%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '9.42', 'Gross Profit Margin': '18.68%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.06', 'Net Profit Margin': '-23.50%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '-0.28', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-8204229.08', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '-10.92%'}}
```
